On Sun, 26 Jan 2003, Daniel Paul Hightower <dph_of_rules@...> wrote:

> I always felt that Soldier is a mana guzzler when compared to the
> other classes.  Boomerang really wasn't that strong of an attack and
> neither is whirlwind for the amount of mana used.

I have also found whirlwind not to be too useful. Usually when I'm in a
situation that requires the use of whirlwind, I use charge to get out.
However, boomerang is one of my favorite abilities. Its especially
powerful when you can launch several at once and when you're fighting a
big crowd. It is kinda useless when you're trying to hit far away (only
hits at like 40 degree intervals or something, so the farther away your
target is, the less likely you are to hit it), but up close it can cause
lots of pain. Boomerangs can also go through walls and trees, which is
rather unrealistic/unfair but is a useful bug/feature.

> Elves are pretty cool, but at about level 30, they lose all their big
> weakness.  At level 30, hypothetically an elf could stay in the middle
> of a forest and continously attack opponents without the risk of being
> harmed because of mana production ability outweighs mana lost while
> staying in a forest.

Hmm... This could possibly be remedied by having an elf not regain mana
while walking through trees, and making mana drain at a rate of a certain
percent of total mana per second rather than a set number. Other than the
tree walking, though, I find elves rather boring. All they have are
variations of rock abilities. One of these days, I will get unlazy and
think of some good abilities to sugest.

However, having said all that, I think characters like elves (and
archmages, although I guess that's for a later week) are too powerful at
high (read: 100+) levels. I just played a scenario where all I did was
megarocks until they cleared everyone out. This goes for soldiers, too. At
very high levels they can just surround themselves with boomerangs and
charge through pretty much anything. All that can probably be remedied
by giving a maximum amount of things a character can control at a time
(ie, rocks, boomerangs, and other things like that).

There also seems to be a bug that makes some rocks stay infinitely in the
game. Its not really a discussion topic, but oh well :-)



- Zardus
